title: 115_hr1351
content: The Act is titled the "Strengthening Oversight of TSA Employee Misconduct Act" and includes a plan for inspecting TSA misconduct. The "Strengthening Oversight of TSA Employee Misconduct Act" includes a provision for unannounced inspections at airports to address TSA employee misconduct. The "Strengthening Oversight of TSA Employee Misconduct Act" mandates unannounced inspections at airports to address TSA employee misconduct, with potential removal from Federal service for non-compliance. Additionally, a senior official must certify completion of inspections biannually until September 30, 2023. The Act mandates unannounced inspections at airports to address TSA employee misconduct, with potential removal from Federal service for non-compliance. Inspections are to be reviewed by a senior official to identify causes of variances and trends in response to misconduct, with corrective actions to be implemented as necessary. Inspections may be consolidated and coordinated with other TSA offices as determined appropriate by the Administrator. The Administrator of the TSA may extend the final date for unannounced inspections for one additional fiscal year in exigent circumstances. Written justification must be provided to relevant committees before granting the extension. The Administrator of the TSA may extend unannounced inspections for one additional fiscal year in exigent circumstances, with written justification provided to relevant committees. Biannually, results of inspections are shared with the Chief Human Capital Officer of the Department of Homeland Security for review and identification of trends to address employee misconduct. The TSA Administrator will implement recommendations in a timely manner and share inspection results with relevant congressional committees. The TSA Administrator will implement recommendations promptly and share inspection results with congressional committees, including Governmental Affairs, Commerce, Science, and Transportation, and Appropriations. No extra funds are authorized for these requirements. Definitions include consequences for employee misconduct and unannounced inspections. The TSA Administrator will implement recommendations promptly and share inspection results with congressional committees. No extra funds are authorized for these requirements. Authorized to carry out the requirements of this Act and the amendments made by this Act using amounts otherwise authorized.
